duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide frontline technical support to end-users.
Diagnose and resolve hardware and software issues for desktops, laptops, printers, peripherals, and other IT equipment.
Install, configure, and maintain operating systems, applications, and software updates.
Troubleshoot network connectivity problems and assist with network-related issues.
Assist in the deployment of new hardware and software, including system imaging and software distribution.
Perform hardware and software upgrades, patches, and maintenance tasks.
Collaborate with other IT team members to escalate and resolve complex technical issues.
Document and maintain accurate records of technical issues, solutions, and user requests.
Provide training and guidance to end-users on basic software and hardware usage.
Maintain an organized inventory of IT equipment, software licenses, and warranties.
Stay updated with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in desktop support.
Occasional lifting and moving of computer equipment, bending, and crawling to access computer and peripheral equipment.

education_certification.credential: Relevant certifications such as CompTIA A+, Microsoft Certified Desktop Support Technician (MCDST), or similar, are a plus.
